alert.note: Alert for Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 13 at 6:11AM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...Flash flooding possible starting Today, followed by windy conditions Tonight through Friday night... A low pressure system embedded within the South Pacific Convergence Zone (SPCZ), as well as the SPCZ itself, could produce hazardous conditions for the territory Today through Friday night. The main threat from this pattern is flash flooding, though winds could reach advisory levels of 20 to 30 mph with higher gusts for Tonight through Friday night. Possible impacts from flash flooding include: flooding in flood- prone and low-lying areas, overflowing of streams, possible landslides, and runoffs. Possible impacts from the aforementioned winds include: risk of unsecured items being blown around, downed tree branches and shallow root trees, possible downed power lines and phone lines, and rough conditions for mariners as well as high surfs for beachgoers.

area.areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu
